articles.title: üìò 30 Most Useful jQuery Snippets

articles.author: Chitransh Soral
articles.description:
Hi there üëã
First of all, I removed the fmt library from my project because of a simple reason- I didn't like the complexity that I had to introduce just to color the prompts in the terminal. Whether it be implementing its namespace, which I agree is very good and its way of formatting the string in the same way as python could help too, but the way it is implemented inside of the library can be made easier. And this is without addressing the other issue- configuring of CMake, even though I tried evverything written in their documentation, it just didn't work. If only it worked, my project would look so soo good, but sometimes you just have to part goodbye to some people to achieve good things in life.
Speaking of goodbyes, last night I added the GitHub workflow for CMake as I thought it would help people looking to contribute in my project, but it had some other plans. I never worked with any GitHub workflow, so I thought why not use GitHub copilot for this task, but it still has a long way to go before it replaces me or any other programmer in the world. It first created the yml file with outdated packages, then after updating the packages, it removed the checking commands which were the whole point of running the workflow in the first place. After this too, it didn't stop as it was running in the agent mode, it went on for a whole hour before I manually deleted the file to remove the hassle altogether (Yeah, the commits are almost consecutively because I pushed them late to the Hub.)
That's all for today, I will be back tomorrow with hopefully some good updates on this project.
Thanks! ü´°
articles.title: DeadLock - Big Changes

articles.author: Vainavi Malapati
articles.description:
Have you ever dreamed of creating your own mystery-themed game, where every decision matters and the thrill of discovery keeps players hooked?
Let me introduce Mystery Adventures ‚Äî a 2D game built using Pygame and supercharged with Amazon Q CLI.
This blog will take you behind the scenes of how I created this game, what tools I used, and how you can get started building your own.
Now! Let‚Äôs meet the main character behind the story ‚Ä¶ üëá

In today‚Äôs fast-paced development world, having the right tools can make or break your productivity. Whether you‚Äôre debugging a mysterious error, trying to understand someone else‚Äôs code, or simply looking for smarter ways to write better code ‚Äî you‚Äôre not alone.
That‚Äôs where Amazon Q CLI steps in.
Amazon Q CLI is a command-line interface version of Amazon Q‚Ä¶
articles.title: üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Unraveling Mysteries with Logic: Behind the Scenes of Mystery Adventures With Pygame and Amazon Q CLI

articles.author: Tyler Johnston-Kent
articles.description:
After Facing Racism at MRU, I‚Äôm Demanding an Honorary Degree ‚Äî and Public Accountability


When I enrolled at Mount Royal University, I expected to be judged by my work ‚Äî not by my identity. I‚Äôm a neurodivergent Indigenous student who came in with ambition, skill, and a deep desire to build something real. What I didn‚Äôt expect was to be humiliated, discredited, and ultimately gaslit by staff and administration who were more interested in protecting each other than upholding any standard of education or equity.
Yasaman Amannejad, one of my instructors, deliberately withheld class information from me. This sabotage felt personal, not professional. I asked for clarity ‚Äî she gave silence.

üëâ https://g.co/kgs/PtzeQXP


Mahsa, another instructor, refused to acknowledge my abilities until I ‚Äúpro‚Ä¶
articles.title: When Universities Protect Themselves Over Indigenous Students: My Story at MRU

articles.author: William Oliver
articles.description:
Smart Tracking: How AI Is Revolutionizing Marketing Analytics
This transformation represents more than just technological advancement‚Äîit's a fundamental reimagining of how businesses understand, predict, and respond to customer behavior. From predictive customer analytics to real-time sentiment tracking, AI has become the invisible engine powering marketing success across industries.
Traditional marketing analytics relied heavily on retrospective reporting and manual data interpretation. Marketers would spend weeks compiling reports from multiple sources, often discovering trends long after they could act on them. This reactive approach left businesses constantly playing catch-up with market dynamics and customer preferences.
The introduction of AI has fundamentally changed this paradigm. ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Smart Tracking: How AI Is Revolutionizing Marketing Analytics

articles.author: Karen Londres
articles.description:
In an era where smart homes and automated services are rapidly evolving, robotic cleaners are becoming an integral part of modern housekeeping. But while the hardware advancements are impressive, the real innovation lies in the way these robots are monitored and controlled‚Äîespecially through cloud platforms.
This article delves into how cloud computing enables scalable, efficient, and intelligent management of cleaning robots, making them more autonomous and easier to manage from anywhere in the world. We'll cover key technologies, potential applications, and even include code snippets to demonstrate practical implementation.
Robotic cleaners are increasingly deployed in both residential and commercial environments. As fleets grow, so does the complexity of their maintenance and control. C‚Ä¶
articles.title: Cloud-Based Monitoring and Control of Robotic Cleaners

articles.author: Anton Martyniuk
articles.description:
There are multiple options for job scheduling in .NET.
The simplest one is creating a Background Service in ASP.NET Core with a static Periodic Timer.
But if you need more customization options and job persistence, you need a library.
My personal favourite is Quartz.NET.
It's a fully-featured, open-source job scheduling system that can be used from the smallest apps to large-scale enterprise systems.
In this post, I will show you:
How to add Quartz.NET to your ASP.NET Core application
How to schedule jobs with different trigger types
How to dynamically create jobs and triggers
How to use Quartz.NET with database persistence using EF Core migrations
Let's dive in.
On my website: antondevtips.com I share .NET and Architecture best practices.
Subscribe to my newsletter to improve your¬†.NET sk‚Ä¶
articles.title: Scheduling Jobs With Quartz and Database Persistence With EF Core Migrations

articles.author: Jakub-bites
articles.description:
Odyssey strikes me as a highly interesting project, particularly for its attempt to craft interactive video experiences using AI. Despite being in its infancy, I'm quite hopeful for its success. The ability to generate snapshots every 40ms in response to user actions is remarkable and, in my opinion, points to a significant future for this technology‚Äîperhaps even leading to a new generation of video games. It's already capable of generating video at up to 30 FPS. 
While the current demo reveals some blurriness and instability in the environments, the company has indicated that rapid advancements are on the horizon, including more precise modeling of world dynamics.
Try current demo
articles.title: Do you know a Odyssey.world?

articles.author: Vijay Kumar
articles.description:
Like many people, my journey into web development didn‚Äôt begin with a computer science degree or a tech job. It started with curiosity‚Äîand a lot of Google searches.
I‚Äôve always been fascinated by how things work. Whenever I visited websites, I‚Äôd often wonder, ‚ÄúHow do these buttons know where to go?‚Äù or ‚ÄúHow does this page look so good?‚Äù For a long time, I thought only professionals or computer geniuses could build websites. But one day, while browsing YouTube, I stumbled across a video titled ‚ÄúHow to Build a Website Using HTML and CSS.‚Äù That one video completely changed my direction.
At first, I was just playing around. I didn‚Äôt know what HTML or CSS stood for‚ÄîI just followed along. I opened Notepad, wrote some lines, saved the file as .html, and opened it in a browser. When I saw my name ‚Ä¶
articles.title: My Web Development Journey: How I Got Started

articles.author: rajeshwari rajeshwari
articles.description:
Great! You're exploring some important programming concepts like comparison operators (===), logical operators (and, or), and post-increment (usercore++). I‚Äôll help you write a simple blog post that introduces these topics in a beginner-friendly way.
===, Logical Operators, and Post-Increment (++) in Programming


If you're new to programming, understanding operators is one of the first steps toward writing powerful, logical code. In this blog post, we'll explore some fundamental concepts:
The === operator
Logical operators like and and or

The post-increment operator (++)
Let‚Äôs break them down with simple examples.
===?


The === operator is strict equality in many languages like JavaScript. It checks both value and type.
5 === 5        // true (same value, same type)
'5' === 5      // fa‚Ä¶
articles.title: üîç Understanding ===, Logical Operators, and Post-Increment (++) in Programming
